intro: Xeraea moquinii, commonly known as the moquinii xeraea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Xeraea moquinii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
